page.title: 11DUKINFIELD LIBRARIES-1
page.content: The earliest recorded library facilities in Dukinfield were the establishment of the Dukinfield Village Library in 1833 by Samuel Robinson in a schoolroom in Providence Chapel. An old beer shop was converted in 1839;the upper part being the library and the lower,the reading room.1853 saw the erection of library premises at Town Lane,then called Wild Green.Francis Dukinfield Astley,Lord of the Manor,paid for the building of a public library and Mechanic's Institute in 1875,on the same site.This building continued in use with modifications and improvements until 1984 when,on 21st November Mr Ron Surridge,President of the Library Association,came to Dukinfield to open the new library on Concord Way.The new library is but a stone's throw away
